alfredsnippet.snippet:
This quote appears toward the end of the third paragraph (from the end), of Eugene Parker's opening chapter, "Solar Physics in Broad Perspective", in The New Solar Physics, J. A. Eddy (Ed.), AAAS Selected Symposium series, Vol. 17, 1978

"The activity of the Sun provides so many effects outside the realm of conventional laboratory physics that its contemplation is a humbling experience for the serious physicist, repeatedly demonstrating the incorrect nature of our best ideas and explanations."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Riddle of the Sun's Physics
